comments.author: IAMDAVEAMI

comments.text:
I don't get it..?
I'm coming from Warcraft III, never played WoW (not rich enough :( ) and I 
can't understand this cinematic.. I thought Grom killed Mannoroth in a 
"2v1" fight (Thrall + Grom but Thrall gets stunned so it's basically Grom 
Vs. Mannoroth).

Is this a remake of this scene in a more epic way or did Mannoroth revived ?
Also I'm a bit confused by the "What will happen when i'll drink 
Mannoroth's blood" (0:56) from Grom (Guess it's him). isn't he supposed to 
have known him for a very long time ? 

If someone could explain me, that'd be awesome. I love Warcraft world's 
lore but I feel like I'm missing something here :(﻿
comments.author: Gaouchos35

comments.text:
The premise of Warlords of Draenor is Garrosh Hellscream went back in time, 
creating an alternate Draenor, and told the Orcs what would happen after 
drinking the blood, and thus Grom was prepared for Mannoroth with the 
Goblin schematics and the like that Garrosh brought back.
comments.author: ZT Lunar

comments.text:
+Gaouchos35 I think it's something like Grommash went back in time and 
tried to alter the orcs destiny or something. I never made any attempt to 
follow lore that WoW attempted to establish, I only enjoyed WoW as THE 
WORLD OF WARCRAFT. 

I really hope that when a new true Warcraft game comes out it stands on its 
own and completely drops all the panda shit in WoW.
comments.author: Chris Hansen

comments.text:
+Gaouchos35 Basically, Bad Time Dragons are fucking up the timeline, 
Garrosh after being convicted of war crimes allies and escapes with one of 
them back in time to Draenor. It's a slightly altered universe, different 
from the one we know (Grom doesn't have a son for example, Garrosh doesn't 
exist) Garrosh then changes events, convinces the Orc's of Gul'Dans trick 
and convinces Grom to reject Mannoroth's gift, which is what you're seeing 
here.


Garrosh wants to make his own Horde without the demon corruption, open a 
Dark Portal to the current version of Azeroth and invade.

comments.author: Ashley Y

comments.text:
The just released cinematic for the new World of Warcraft expansion, 
Warlords of Draenor. I really love how the opening music closely resembles 
the LOTR Twin Towers Orc theme score. As this area will only be available 
to level 90's, it will certainly be an epic questing, dungeon, and raid 
experience!﻿

comments.text:
Blizzard, what are u doing wih storyline?!!  Why?! Whats wrong? Two 
different dimensions now - original storyline and changed storyline, two 
different  Draenors (Draenor planet and Outland)... OMG... My brains... 
WarCraft has cool storyline line, backline - That is WarCraft: Orcs and 
Humans, WarCraft II Tide of Darkness/Beyond the Dark Portal; WarCraft III 
Reign of Chaos/Frozen Throne  and a lot of books.
After too many add-on's for WoW... maybe you need  just create new game?! 
Or  create different add-on, without  time traveling... Seriosly, Blizzard, 
that is not good way for WoW ;-/﻿

comments.author: Saul Goodman

comments.text:
I've learned a lot about Draenor over the course of watching these vids, 
reading the lore, and expanding my fantasy horizons.  Outland/Draenor is 
practically a carbon copy of Dark Sun's Athas; The Arakkoa (Arakkocra), the 
ruined, almost desert world corrupted by magic, the blood sports, the lack 
of major cities save for the ones that act as strongholds ruled by almost 
god-like beings, who in turn command their followers with an almost 
stockholm-syndrome-like reverence (*cough*Ogres*Gruun*cough*)...it screams 
Dark Sun.

Don't get me wrong, I'm not complaining.  I actually like the influences 
made by one of the more intriguing of D&D's campaign settings on WoW's 
storytelling.  Besides which, are any of us surprised?  This is Blizzard, 
after all.﻿

+Anidem9 Fel orcs were created form Pit Lord blood, namely Magtheridon. The 
Bonechewer Behemoths of the Black Temple raid had black skin and blue eyes. 
However, as is shown in the upcoming raid, Mannoroth is resurrected, so his 
blood is still very active, even when deceased.

I know this is a bit knit picky - but the only reason Grom could kill 
mannaroth in Warcraft 3 was because he had already drank from the the 
demons blood which gave him a "chaotic" strength. There is no way Grom 
could kill THE Mannaroth without it. Especially with one hit haha.﻿
comments.author: Kyle Herring

comments.text: hahahah! Fair enough. I guess those catapults are pretty OP.
comments.author: Kyle Herring

comments.text: +Kyle Herring He has advanced technology and the element of surprise.
